evidence.text:
Person B: So...how does this usually work?
Person B: I don't know. I'm just really scared.
Person B: He's a bad person. You don't know what I married into... and just keeps getting worse and worse.
Person B: Did you always know you wanted to be a...?
Person B: Do you ever think about... like, if you did something else? Or if you chose a different path?
Person B: Well, we all have regrets...
Person B: Wish I could do that. I just feel like I'm in prison, and I am going to die in prison.
Person B: But I'm not going to die in prison, because what if me coming here and meeting with you is the best decision I've ever made because it's for me.

Person A: Listen, there's nothing in this for me - technically, I'm un-employing myself here, but do your future self, the one that deserves a happy, fulfilling life, that can still have that, a big favor. Take what's in there and get a new life. Right now. Don't go home.
Person A: And, if you need anything or if you change your mind... you have my number.

Person B: Tell me a little more about the unprofessional side.
Person B: Good. I don't want you too professional.
Person B: You know, I haven't been with anyone else in so long... Can I tell you something?
Person B: I like this, us.
Person B: Fuck normal.
Person B: Do you wanna see me again?
Person B: It doesn't have to be.
Person B: I suppose it is. A charged moment, then --

Person A: I was once told I think too much to be a good lover. She said exceptional sex requires a lack of thought - a certain amount of animal abandon...
Person A: ...So, I don't know if I was just better as Ron, or if it was that electric charge going through both of us...After all, in her mind, she was having sex with someone who had murdered a bunch of people, and I was having sex with someone who was clearly capable of having a lover killed.

Person B: Okay, what's your next line, "don't fall in love with me?" I know what this is. I don't want to know where you live, or what you're doing at any given moment. We're just going to meet here whenever we want and nothing outside of here matters.
Person B: Well, okay.
Person A: So, we agree to the terms?
Person B: Where do I sign?
Person B: Anywhere else I need to sign?
Person B: Anywhere else I need to initial?
Person B: We gotta make sure...this document...is air tight.

Person A: We have to leave our love nest at some point, don't we?
Person A: Why don't you show me, hot shot.
Person A: Let's go dance, white boy.

Person A: Wait, wait, wait... Tell me this one more time - he's trying to put a hit out on me?
Person A: And he saw you in person?
Person A: And he knows what you do?
Person A: So...are you going to kill me?
Person A: Are you gonna kill me?

Person A: Because I killed him.
Person A: Yeah.
Person A: You told me yourself, he was gonna come and kill me!
Person A: Technically...
Person A: He was either passed out or asleep.
Person A: Yeah, and I made a story, and they're believing it.
Person A: Why are you getting so worked up about this? You do this shit all the time.
Person A: What are you talking about?
Person A: You're a cop?!
Person A: You've been lying to me this whole time?!
Person A: Don't. Just leave, whatever your name is.
Person A: I didn't kill him! Who's accusing me of this? This is bullshit! You out of all people should know I wasn't capable of this!

Person A: Shit, so am I. Good men are rare these days. He stood up for me, he protected me. So, you know what? If they find him, you let me know.
Person A: Ray's family has money - they do shit like this, they take out insurance. Look, I don't even know if I get any of that money. For all I know, he changed the beneficiary when we broke up.

Person B: We don't have a choice. Look, I know you're taking a big leap with me and there are some factual loose threads we'll be dealing with. But I think I'm in love with you.
Person A: It's always a leap... And for the record, I think I'm in love with you, too. For better or worse?
Person A: Right.
Person B: So, we're in this till the end? Till death us do part?
Person A: Yes, because I don't believe in divorce.
Person A: I'm kidding.
Person A: So, do we agree on the terms?

Person B: And your mother, well, what can I say, it was love at first sight... she ended up making a new man out of me... But to answer your question, we met at a magical little place called the Please U Cafe.
